name: Grand Hotel Villa Cora

reviews.text: We loved our experience at this hotel. It was recently reopened after a four year renovation. Not only is it exquisite, but the staff is some of the friendliest and most helpful we have ever met. The hotel restaurant has fantastic food and the staff bent over backwards to please both my husband and me and our two children. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Disregard any reviews that predate 2010 as they refer to the hotel under different management and before the refurbishment.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel. Great experience!

reviews.text: This place is truly amazing and just may be the BEST luxury hotel in Florence. It is worth noting that the hotel just openend in December 2010 and had been closed for 4 years to undergo a fantastic restoration project. Any reviews on Trip Advisor older than Dec 2010 should be disregarded as the property is brand new and under completely different management.
reviews.title: Heaven!!!!!!

reviews.text: My husband & I renewed our wedding vows with our Children 22 & 25 at the fron of Villa Cora with a celebrant. The hotel staff were amazing the restaurant was also amazing. We will never forget it. The location of the hotel is a beautiful part of Florence. We stayed in the middle floor of the front of the building. We cant wait to go back now with all the great renovations. The hotel gave us a beautiful solid pendant in a gorgeous blue box on our very special day - Grand Villa Cora % Stas all the way xx
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.text: This property is tired and badly needs refurbishment, both to the rooms/facility and to the attitude of key members of the staff. The public areas are beautiful but then you have to go to rooms where there is no temperature control and you can't open the windows without letting in every biting insect imaginable, showers are broken, and TVs barely work. (A bellman worked over an hour to get ours to turn on.) Not even a three star hotel when strictly evaluating room comfort, cleanliness, and staff. (However, the breakfast servers were Great!)
reviews.title: Over the Hill!

likes.liked: — Servers at breakfast were friendly and attentive.

reviews.text: We have stayed at some of the best hotels in Europe and we would place Villa Cora near the top. The concierge staff bent over backwards for us and was as pleasant as can be. Stefano and Roberto were friendly and always smiling. They always greeted us, made reservations for everything within minutes of our requests, and were knowledegeable about restaurants, museums, and transportation. The breakfasts were delicious with some of the best fruits and croissants. We were able to order eggs whatever way you desired with a variety of meats on the side. The pool was refreshing and the grounds beautiful. They are closing for reservation because the structure need some fixing but what would you expect with such a grand old villa. I'll be there when the renovation is completed.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: We found the Villa Cora staff very helpful, especially after AlItlalia (dont ever use use that airline!) lost our luggage and didn't seem to care at all whether we ever got our bags back or not. They are doing a renovation soon, so i think some of the other reviewers may like the place more in the future.
reviews.title: Better than Average Service, Great away-from-the-fray location

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed a few days at the Villa Cora this Summer. We had visited Florence before and were really looking forward to our stay. We booked the Villa Cora because it has a pool and was close to the town centre AND because it was meant to be a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1 Really unfriendly staff. I dont think the staff on the front desk liked to be disturbed. Most of their answers were monosyllabic and never with a smile. We never got a good morning or good evening from any of them.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

likes.liked: — Pool and roome with an amazing view

reviews.text: 2 Hotel had its day. The Villa Cora used to be grand I expect. Now it appears run down and old. You have to eat all your meals by the pool in a sperate building. The main hotel building only has bedrooms. They do provide meals in the main hotel but only for visitors not hotel guests. The water from our shower ran across the bathroom floor. Everyday we had to put towels down to soak the water up. Probably a legitimate health and safety issue. The hotel also smells musty and looks a bit like a furtuniture stock room.
reviews.title: The Epitomy of Rudeness

reviews.text: 3 Breakfast. The breakfast was very average and compared to a hotel we stayed in this Summer for a third of the prize. The staff at breakfast like the staff at reception really couldn't be bothered.
reviews.title: Rude and Unhelpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for one night att he end of our honeymoon is Florence. We had a junior suite in the main building on the 2nd floor, and it was beautiful. Lovely period furniture, a huge and comfy bed, 2 large marble bathrooms and a seperate seating area with a television.
reviews.title: Junior Suite

reviews.text: The hotel is to the south of the Arno, but it is only a 15 minute walk around the edge of the Bobolini Gardens, and through the Roman Gate, to the Ponte Vecchio.
reviews.title: Magical!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ordered room service, which was delicious, and it was delivered quickly and politely.
reviews.title: Why are you going to Florence?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in what is obviously an up-market suburb of Florence, so its the perfect place to come if you're looking for somewhere away from the throngs of tourists in the city centre, but it is definitely close enough to walk straight into the centre.
reviews.title: Fit for a princess

reviews.text: The hotel also has a swimming pool, which we did not use, but that looked busy with adults and children and more than a few inflatables!
reviews.title: fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decoration and architecture of the hotel is a work of an artist.
reviews.title: I will never return to Villa Cora

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not count with anything more than that.
reviews.title: Out of a fairy tale ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want, to stay in a hotel where will you feel like a special person, please look for another hotel. I can suggest two where we've stayed: IL Salviatino and Le Maschere.
reviews.title: opulance and a great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived there, a really unplesant receptionist made us, me and my groom, think twice, about stay in Villa Cora. For the first time in my life I felt like I was not welcome to a place. But i was really exausted, then we decided to keep the room which we had booked. In our room the lights didn´t work, we´ve called to reception and they sent to our bedroom, a boy who carried our bags, to check the problem.
reviews.title: A Masterpiece in Florence

reviews.text: He doesn´t resolved the problem and went out. Then two men, dressed inappropriately arrived at our bedroom accompanied by a person who I believe was the hotel manager. After 10 minutes, they had failed in resolve the problem, again, then they decided to offer to us another room . We sent some clothes for the laundry of the hotel, the person responsible for the service, filled the form out of our room and left us with no copy at hand. A pair of trousers that was part of a suit disappeared and the concierge said to us, we had never sent this to wash. As we had no copies of the form, with us, we couldn't prove. That remained our word against the maid words . They do not take responsibility for the disappear of the pants and my groom had to buy another one with his own money, to go to a wedding party. The wedding party was the reason why we were in town.
reviews.title: Villa Cora deserves a sixth star for beauty, food, service and kindness

description: The GRAND HOTEL VILLA CORA is a 5 star resort located in a 19th century mansion with a large park, bordering the gardens along Viale dei Colli, within walking distance from Boboli and Oltrarno and considered the “grand lady” of Florence southern hills. Its 46 rooms and suites, heated pool in the park, Gourmet’s Restaurant and Spa make it the ultimate, exquisitely sophisticated “city resort”.
